metadata.title: Test FedRAMP System Security Plan (SSP)

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: The FedRAMP PMO resides within GSA and supports agencies and cloud service providers through the FedRAMP authorization process and maintains a secure repository of FedRAMP authorizations to enable reuse of security packages.

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: Members of the JAB include the chief information officers (CIOs) from the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, and General Services Administration. The JAB serves as the primary governance and decision-making body for FedRAMP.

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.description: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.description: The organization for which this SSP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: System Security Plan Approval
roles.description: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SSP.

roles.title: Information System Owner
roles.description: The individual within the CSP who is ultimately accountable for everything related to this system.

roles.title: Authorizing Official
roles.description: The individual or individuals who must grant this system an authorization to operate.

roles.title: Authorizing Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual representing the authorizing official.

roles.title: Information System Management Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: The highest level manager who responsible for system operation on behalf of the System Owner.

roles.title: Information System Technical Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual or individuals leading the technical operation of the system.

roles.title: General Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: A general point of contact for the system, designated by the system owner.

roles.title: System Information System Security Officer (or Equivalent)
roles.description: The individual accountable for the security posture of the system on behalf of the system owner.

roles.title: Privacy Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual responsible for the privacy threshold analysis and if necessary the privacy impact assessment.

roles.title: Owner of an inventory item within the system.
Administrative responsibility an inventory item within the system.
ICA POC (Local)
roles.description: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this system.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA POC (Remote)
roles.description: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this external system to which this system connects.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA Signatory (Local)
roles.description: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of this system.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA Signatory (Remote)
roles.description: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of the external system to which this system connects.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: Consultant
roles.description: Any consultants involved with developing or maintaining this content.

roles.title: Customer
roles.description: Represents any customers of this system as may be necessary for assigning customer responsibility.

roles.title: [SAMPLE]Unix Administrator
roles.description: This is a sample role.

roles.title: [SAMPLE]Client Administrator
roles.description: This is a sample role.

locations.title: CSP HQ
locations.remarks: There must be one location identifying the CSP's primary business address, such as the CSP's HQ, or the address of the system owner's primary business location.

parties.name: Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Name
parties.remarks:
Replace sample CSP information.

CSP information must be present and associated with the \"cloud-service-provider\" role via `responsible-party`.

parties.name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Program Management Office
parties.remarks:
This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.

The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the \"fedramp-pmo\" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

parties.name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Joint Authorization Board
parties.remarks:
This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.

The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the \"fedramp-jab\" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

parties.name: External Organization
parties.remarks: Generic placeholder for any external organization.

parties.name: Agency Name
parties.remarks: Generic placeholder for an authorizing agency.

metadata.remarks:
This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SSP Template can be used for the FedRAMP Low, Moderate, and High baselines.

Guidance for OSCAL-based FedRAMP Tailored Low Impact - Software as a Service (LI-SaaS) content has not yet been developed.

import-profile.remarks:
This example points to the FedRAMP Rev 5 Moderate baseline that is part of the official FedRAMP 1.0.4 release.

Must adjust accordingly for applicable baseline and revision.

system-characteristics.description:
[Insert CSO Name] is delivered as [a/an] [insert based on the Service Model above] offering using a multi-tenant [insert based on the Deployment Model above] cloud computing environment. It is available to [Insert scope of customers in accordance with instructions above (for example, the public, federal, state, local, and tribal governments, as well as research institutions, federal contractors, government contractors etc.)].

NOTE: Additional description, including the purpose and functions of this system may be added here. This includes any narrative text usually included in section 9.1 of the SSP.

NOTE: The description is expected to be at least 32 words in length.

props.name: cloud-service-model
props.remarks: Remarks are required if service model is \"other\". Optional otherwise.

props.name: cloud-deployment-model
props.remarks: Remarks are required if deployment model is \"hybrid-cloud\" or \"other\". Optional otherwise.

confidentiality-impact.adjustment-justification: Required if the base and selected values do not match.

integrity-impact.adjustment-justification: Required if the base and selected values do not match.

availability-impact.adjustment-justification: Required if the base and selected values do not match.

status.remarks:
Remarks are optional if status/state is \"operational\".

Remarks are required otherwise.

authorization-boundary.description: A holistic, top-level explanation of the FedRAMP authorization boundary.

network-architecture.description: A holistic, top-level explanation of the network architecture.

data-flow.description: A holistic, top-level explanation of the system's data flows.

leveraged-authorizations.title: GovCloud
leveraged-authorizations.remarks:
Use one leveraged-authorization assembly for each underlying system. In the legacy world, these may be general support systems.

The link fields are optional, but preferred when known. Often, a leveraging system's SSP author will not have access to the leveraged system's SSP, but should have access to the leveraged system's CRM.

props.name: authentication-method
props.value: memorized seccret plus SF OTP device

authorized-privileges.title: Portal administration
functions-performed: Create, modify and delete client applications

authorized-privileges.title: Administrative Access Approver
functions-performed: Approves access requests for administrative accounts.

authorized-privileges.title: Access Approver
functions-performed: Approves access requests for administrative accounts.

authorized-privileges.title: External System Access Provider
functions-performed: Authorizes access to external interconnected system.

components.title: This System
components.description:
The entire system as depicted in the system authorization boundary

Email is employed

components.title: [SAMPLE]Cryptographic Module Name
components.description:
Provide a description and any pertinent note regarding the use of this CM.

For data-at-rest modules, describe type of encryption implemented (e.g., full disk, file, record-level, etc.)

Lastly, provide any supporting notes on FIPS status (e.g. historical) or lack of FIPS compliance (e.g., Module in Process).

components.title: [SAMPLE]Cryptographic Module Name
components.description:
Provide a description and any pertinent note regarding the use of this CM.

For example, any supporting notes on FIPS status (e.g. historical) or lack of FIPS compliance (e.g., Module in Process).

components.title: Name of Leveraged System
components.description:
If the leveraged system owner provides a UUID for their system (such as in an OSCAL-based CRM), it should be reflected in the `inherited-uuid` property.

Must include all leveraged services and features from the leveraged authorization here.

components.title: Service Provided by Leveraged System
components.description:
If the leveraged system owner provides a UUID for their service (such as in an OSCAL-based CRM), it should be reflected in the `inherited-uuid` property.

Must include all leveraged services and features from the leveraged authorization here.

components.title: [EXAMPLE]Authorized Connection Information System Name
components.description: Describe the purpose of the external system/service; specifically, provide reasons for connectivity (e.g., system monitoring, system alerting, download updates, etc.).

props.name: interconnection-security
props.remarks: If \"other\", remarks are required. Optional otherwise.

components.title: [SAMPLE]Product Name
components.remarks: COMMENTS: Provide other comments as needed.

components.title: [SAMPLE]Product
components.remarks: COMMENTS: Provide other comments as needed.

components.title: [EXAMPLE]Policies
components.description: [EXAMPLE]component representing a collection of policies in appendix A.
components.remarks: Links to the components, attached as a `resource` in `back-matter`.

components.title: [EXAMPLE]Procedures
components.description: [EXAMPLE]component representing a collection of procedures in appendix A.
components.remarks: Links to the components, attached as a `resource` in `back-matter`.

components.title: [SAMPLE]Service Name
components.purpose: Describe the reason the service is needed.
components.remarks:
Section 10.2, Table 10-1. Ports, Protocols and Services

 **SERVICES ARE NOW COMPONENTS WITH type='service'**

props.name: interconnection-security
props.remarks: If \"other\", remarks are required. Optional otherwise.

props.name: allows-authenticated-scan
props.remarks: If no, explain why. If yes, omit remarks field.

props.name: is-scanned
props.remarks: If no, explain why. If yes, omit remarks field.

implemented-components.remarks: This links to a FIPS 140-2 validated software component that is used by this inventory item. This type of linkage to a validation through the component is preferable to the link[rel='validation'] example above.

inventory-items.remarks: COMMENTS: Additional information about this item.

props.name: allows-authenticated-scan
props.remarks: If no, explain why. If yes, omit remark.

inventory-items.remarks: COMMENTS: If needed, provide additional information about this inventory item.

props.name: is-scanned
props.remarks: Asset wasn't running at time of scan.

props.name: is-scanned
props.remarks: Asset wasn't running at time of scan.

control-implementation.description:
Appendix A - FedRAMP SSP Rev5 Template

This description field is required by OSCAL.

FedRAMP does not require any specific information here.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: Describe the plan to complete the implementation.

by-components.description: Describe how the control is satisfied within the system.
Describe how Part a is satisfied within the system.
by-components.remarks:
The specified component is the system itself.

Any control implementation response that can not be associated with another component is associated with the component representing the system.

by-components.description: Describe how this policy component satisfies part a.
Describe how Part b is satisfied within the system for a component.
Describe how Part b is satisfied within the system for another component.
Describe how Part b-1 is satisfied.
Describe how Part b-2 is satisfied.

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: Describe the plan to complete the implementation.

props.name: control-origination
props.remarks: Describe any customer-configured requirements for satisfying this control.

by-components.description: Describe how the control is satisfied within the system.

Describe how AC-2, part a is satisfied within this system.

This points to the \"This System\" component, and is used any time a more specific component reference is not available.

provided.description: Leveraged system's statement of capabilities which may be inherited by a leveraging systems to satisfy AC-2, part a.

responsibilities.description:
Leveraged system's statement of a leveraging system's responsibilities in satisfaction of AC-2, part a.

Not associated with inheritance, thus associated this with the by-component for \"this system\".

by-components.description: For the portion of the control satisfied by the application component of this system, describe **how** the control is met.

provided.description:
Consumer-appropriate description of what may be inherited from this application component by a leveraging system.

In the context of the application component in satisfaction of AC-2, part a.

responsibilities.description:
Leveraging system's responsibilities with respect to inheriting this capability from this application.

In the context of the application component in satisfaction of AC-2, part a.

by-components.remarks:
The component-uuid above points to the \"this system\" component.

Any control response content that does not cleanly fit another system component is placed here. This includes customer responsibility content.

This can also be used to provide a summary, such as a holistic overview of how multiple components work together.

While the \"this system\" component is not explicitly required within every `statement`, it will typically be present.

by-components.description: For the portion inherited from an underlying FedRAMP-authorized provider, describe **what** is inherited.

inherited.description:
Optional description.

Consumer-appropriate description of what may be inherited as provided by the leveraged system.

In the context of this component in satisfaction of AC-2, part a.

The `provided-uuid` links this to the same statement in the leveraged system's SSP.

It may be linked directly, but is more commonly provided via an OSCAL-based CRM (Inheritance and Responsibility Model).

satisfied.description:
Description of how the responsibility was satisfied.

The `responsibility-uuid` links this to the same statement in the leveraged system's SSP.

It may be linked directly, but is more commonly provided via an OSCAL-based CRM (Inheritance and Responsibility Model).

Tools should use this to ensure all identified customer `responsibility` statements have a corresponding `satisfied` statement in the leveraging system's SSP.

Tool developers should be mindful that
